results.title: Track events
results.creator_credit: George H. Fox, Jan Sadlo and AIMS Instructional Media
results.brief_description:
Episode number 1 of Series “Fundamentals of the Track and Field for Girls”.
This film designed as a teaching tool, emphasizes form and technique. It covers track and field events in girls competition such as: sprints, middle-distance and distance running, hurdles and relays

results.title: Fundamentals of photography: light sensitive materials
results.brief_description: This film discusses the physics of light and colour; shows how light-sensitive materials may be classified according to their light sensitivity; explains the composition of such light-sensitive materials.

results.title: Fun radio!
results.brief_description: A casual glance at the Australian summer weekend. A troupe of pop singers is greeted at the airport by a large crowd. In the suburbs people are seen at their homes. Life in Melbourne is seen as a great religious festival, complete with rituals, taboos and minor deities.

results.title: Fun factory
results.creator_credit: Saul J. Turell, Paul Killiam and Sterling Educational Films
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “History of the Motion Picture”.
This film tells of Mack Sennett’s rise from movie extra to king of comedy. It also looks at the style and the actors of the Mack Sennett studio, famous for its “Keystone Cops” films. Uses excerpts from films of the period.

results.title: Full circle: the work of Doris Chase
results.creator_credit: Doris Chase, Elizabeth Wood and Perspective Films
results.brief_description: Documentary on painter, sculptor and filmmaker, Doris Chase. Ms Chase explains her work including the development of her sculptural furnishings for modern dance groups into video film works.

results.title: Frying methods
results.creator_credit: Dennis Shand, Film Workshop and Gas Council
results.brief_description: Demonstrates the following methods of frying foods: deep frying, shallow frying, dry frying and the frying of sweet dishes. Vegetables, fish, eggs, steak, bacon and port are some of the foods used in this film.

results.title: Frustration and fixation
results.creator_credit: Paul Ellen, Robert S. Feldman and University of Massachusetts at Amherst. Laboratory of Psychometric & Evaluation Research
results.brief_description: Documents Maier’s thesis that frustration leads to fixation and other bizarre sysmptoms. Shows a modified Lashley jumping apparatus and describes the process of teaching rats to jump. Frustrated animals finally assigned to soluble problems persist in fixations in spite of opening correct doors, and although walking trials demonstrate that they know the correct choice. Includes demonstrations of catatonic and neurotic behaviour.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Paul Ellen, Robert S. Feldman and University of Massachusetts at Amherst. Laboratory of Psychometric & Evaluation Research
results.description: Documents Maier’s thesis that frustration leads to fixation and other bizarre sysmptoms. Frustrated animals finally assigned to soluble problems persist in fixations in spite of opening correct doors, and although walking trials demonstrate that they know the correct choice. Includes demonstrations of catatonic and neurotic behaviour.

results.title: From ten to twelve
results.creator_credit: Edmund Reid, Judith Crawley, Crawley Films and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Ages and Stages”.
Quite far removed from infancy, yet not across the threshold of adolescence, children of ten to twelve present an absorbing study of adults-in-the-making. We watch the children of one family in various situations in the home, at school and in group play, and find that much of their conflicting behavior is actually a normal part of the growing-up process.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Edmund Reid, Judith Crawley, Crawley Films and National Film Board of Canada
